definition: (idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to sigh/to exclaim
variant of 嘆|叹[tan4]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
to stop/to prohibit/until/only

sentences.english: The fledglings were amazing to watch as they tried to fly for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 那些刚长羽毛的小鸟初次飞行的样子令人叹为观止。

sentences.english: The colors are a result of volcanic activity. The beauty is breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 这些色彩是火山活动的结果，其美丽令人叹为观止。

sentences.english: Doctor J's dunks were wondrous to the eye.
sentences.chinese: 博士的扣篮让人叹为观止。

sentences.english: Brocard angle is an admirable classic in mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 勃罗卡角是数学的一个经典，令人叹为观止。

sentences.english: The juggler was the amazement of the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 变戏法者使市民们叹为观止。

sentences.english: It was just a spectacular place.
sentences.chinese: 这是个宁人叹为观止的地方。

sentences.english: The group of explorer were stunned by the view from the summit.
sentences.chinese: 探险队员们对山顶的景色叹为观止。

sentences.english: Face reading Qu really sighs for the view to this young.
sentences.chinese: 面相觑，对这位少年真是叹为观止。

sentences.english: This shows of noodles in datong charm really amazing.
sentences.chinese: 由此可见刀削面在大同的魅力真的令人叹为观止。

sentences.english: The stunning landscape in which Guilin is situated has a kind of magic that is all its own.
sentences.chinese: 桂林景观令人叹为观止，拥有一种自成一体的魅力。

sentences.english: The quickness and agility of a good shortstop can certainly be awe-inspiring.
sentences.chinese: 杰出游击手的迅速和灵活绝对令人叹为观止。

sentences.english: Women have strengths that amaze men.
sentences.chinese: 女人具有男人所叹为观止的力量。

sentences.english: Watch breathtaking movies and mind-bending TV shows.
sentences.chinese: 看看那些叹为观止的电影和引你深思的电视节目。

sentences.english: It’s the price we pay for all that amazing human intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们要为叹为观止的人类智力所付出的代价。

sentences.english: The tourists will be marveled at a dazzling exhibition of their stone inscriptions in the resort.
sentences.chinese: 他们留下的石刻碑文，令游客目不暇接，叹为观止。

definition: to be full of praise (idiom)
to exclaim in astonishment
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
(to gasp) with admiration
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
stupefied/flabbergasted
to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
to exclaim in admiration
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
to be dazzled and stunned (idiom)
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
(idiom) brilliant/extremely skillful/virtuosic
